contentrichtext.text: {{Other uses of|Nero}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox lake | lake_name = Lake Nero | image_lake = Lake nero.jpg | caption_lake = near [[Rostov]] (2006) | image_bathymetry = | caption_bathymetry = | location = [[Yaroslavl Oblast]] | coords = {{Coord|57|9|53|N|39|26|12|E|type:waterbody_region:RU|display=inline,title}} | type = [[eutrophic]] | inflow = Sara ({{Lang-ru|Сара}}), Ishnya ({{Lang-ru|Ишня}}), Kuchibosh ({{Lang-ru|Кучибош}}), Mazikha ({{Lang-ru|Мазиха}}), Varus ({{Lang-ru|Варус}}), Chucherka ({{Lang-ru|Чучерка}}), Unitsa ({{Lang-ru|Уница}}), Sula ({{Lang-ru|Сула}}) | outflow = Veksa | catchment = | basin_countries = Russia | length = {{Convert|13|km|mi|abbr=on}} | width = {{Convert|8|km|mi|abbr=on}} | area = {{Convert|544|km2|sqmi|abbr=on}} | depth = | max-depth = | volume = | residence_time = | shore = | elevation = | islands = 2 (Levsky, Christmases) | cities = [[Rostov]] | frozen = }} [[Image:Rostov19.jpg|thumb|left|View of [[Rostov]] from Nero Lake (photo 2006).]] '''Lake Nero''' ({{Lang-ru|Не́ро}}) is a shallow, highly [[eutrophic]] lake in [[Yaroslavl Oblast]], [[Russia]]. The lake has an area of 54.4 km², a maximum length of 13 km, width 8 km and depth 3.6 m. The bottom of the lake is covered with thick layer of [[silt]] [[sapropel]] (a sort of ooze used as [[fertilizer]] and for other purposes). The lake is estimated to be about 500 thousand years old, making it one of a few pre-[[ice age]] lakes in central Russia. The first people settled at the lake at 6 thousand years ago. It is historically certain that the [[Merya]] tribe had their capital in [[Sarskoe Gorodishche]] on the southern shore of the lake. They named the lake ''Nero'' (meaning "silty", "marshland") or ''Kaovo'' ("place where [[gull]]s live"). In the 9th Century [[East Slavic peoples|East Slavs]] came to the lake. They called the lake ''Rostovian Lake'' in the honor of town [[Rostov]]. There are two islands in Nero: ''Levsky'' ({{Lang-ru|Левский}}, meaning "Forest Island") and ''Rozhdestvenskij'' ({{Lang-ru|''Рождественский''}}, meaning "Christmas Island"). The latter is also known as ''Gorodskoj''({{Lang-ru|''Городской''}}, meaning "City Island"). This island formed a pre-[[ice age]] [[monolith]]. Flowing into Nero Lake are eight rivers (Sara ({{Lang-ru|Сара}}), Ishnya ({{Lang-ru|Ишня}}), Kuchibosh ({{Lang-ru|Кучибош}}), Mazikha ({{Lang-ru|Мазиха}}), Varus ({{Lang-ru|Варус}}), Chucherka ({{Lang-ru|Чучерка}}), Unitsa ({{Lang-ru|Уница}}), Sula ({{Lang-ru|Сула}}) etc.), one flows out (Veksa ({{Lang-ru|Векса}})). [[Image:Rostov14.jpg|thumb|View of Spaso-Yakovlevsky abbey in [[Rostov]] from Nero Lake (photo 2006).]] [[Image:Rostov23.jpg|thumb|left|View of Spaso-Yakovlevsky abbey in [[Rostov]] from Nero Lake (photo 2006)]] Near Nero Lake is located the town of [[Rostov]] (on the western shore of the lake) and a few villages (on perimeter): Porech’e-Rybnoe ({{Lang-ru|Поречье-Рыбное}}), Ugodichi ({{Lang-ru|Угодичи}}), Vorzha ({{Lang-ru|Воржа}}), L’vy ({{Lang-ru|Львы}}) etc. The first steamboat ''Emel’yan'' ({{Lang-ru|''Емельян''}}) appeared on the Lake in 1883.
